WorkExperience.title: Freelance Data Visualization Engineer/Designer
duties: Building custom WordPress pages and ACF modules for client sites with Barefoot PR
Designed and built a responsive prototype web app for White Flower Farm, combining geographical, ecological and botanical datasets to connect gardeners with native plants
Collaborated with the Lenfest Institute and INN to create data dashboard and accompanying analysis for state-level news publisher business metrics
Gathered and cleaned data, developed charts and bespoke UI, and wrote copy for a visual essay about NBA uniforms for the Pudding
Turned an illustration of the standard model of particle physics into a React-based interactive for Science News
Visualized federal funding data through charts and maps for the Journalist's Resource, a project of the Harvard Kennedy School’s Shorenstein Center
Designed a matchday printed handout for fans for the New England Revolution, using D3.js to visualize game history

WorkExperience.title: WordPress Developer, Frontend (part-time)
duties: Built frontends, editor interfaces, and design systems in WordPress block themes, including theme.json, custom React blocks, and plugin configuration
Translated Figma designs into semantic, maintainable UI components in collaboration with designers and project managers
Performed frontend maintenance on legacy WordPress and Next.js sites including build-process updates, accessibility improvements and UI refactoring
Worked with UX, PM, and dev colleagues to refine designs and plan project workflows

WorkExperience.title: User Experience Developer II
duties: Shipped reusable components and page templates for high-traffic WordPress and Next.js apps using React, TypeScript and modern tooling, ensuring accessibility, performance and maintainability
Worked across the stack to integrate API data, external services, CI/CD pipelines and frontend tests
Led accessibility audits to improve screen reader support, color contrast, and keyboard navigation
Collaborated closely with fully remote Scrum teams and client stakeholders from planning and backlog refinement to client demos and delivery
Prototyped and built static and interactive chart designs for dataviz projects, using Figma and JavaScript libraries

WorkExperience.title: Frontend and Data Developer
duties: Designed and developed interactive maps, graphics and microsites using custom Svelte/D3 rig, connecting faculty research and collaborative university initiatives to the wider public
Designed, built and maintained the university’s public-facing COVID-19 testing dashboard
Authored dataviz style guide combining best-practice information design with brand standards
Maintained and added features to department WordPress site, using Twig templates and the Timber framework

WorkExperience.title: Frontend Developer/Designer
duties: Worked with a small, remote scrum team designing and building WordPress sites and open-source plugins for nonprofit media outlets
Created UI wireframes, prototypes, style tiles and design systems for client projects
Updated internal branding guidelines and assets, for both print and digital uses

WorkExperience.title: Editorial Developer
duties: Designed and built web-native tools and data visualizations based on new and archive content
Iterated and implemented new processes to bridge design, tech and editorial desks
Built and maintained Node-based Slack chatbots, both internal- and external-facing

WorkExperience.title: Digital Media Manager (prev. Deputy Web Editor)
duties: Created Bootstrap-based WordPress themes for Kids VT, Vermont Tech Jam and Restaurant Week sites
Managed migration projects, redesigns and daily production of six email newsletters
Directed election coverage on social media, live blogs, chats and results dashboards
Contributed multimedia elements, charts and blog posts to editorial products

Talks.title: First SvelteKit Data App
Talks.content: I lead hands-on sessions at two NICAR conferences to help data journalists learn how to build data-driven, dynamic, easily deployable apps using SvelteKit.

Talks.title: Building a Culture of Accessibility and UX in Your Organization
Talks.content: I facilitated a group discussion of about twenty news website editors on the common obstacles they face in getting user-centered, accessible experiences to be prioritized in under-resourced newsrooms.

Talks.title: Boosting Careers Without the Ladder
Talks.content: I co-facilitated a working session on how early- and mid-career journalists can advance their careers in organizations where technical or product-oriented skills are undervalued.

Talks.title: A Data Analysis of My Drinking Habits
Talks.content: I gave a lightning talk about what I learned by loading my data from the beer-rating app Untappd into RStudio for a graduate-level statistics course.

Talks.title: Advancing with Visual Analytics: Key (Free) Programs to Dissect Your Data
Talks.content: I presented to a professional workshop on free software to manage, analyze and visualize data, with examples that included Plotly, Infogram, and DocumentCloud.

Talks.title: Responsive Design and Dataviz
Talks.content: For a meetup of frontend professionals, I presented examples of web-based data visualizations that tackled desktop-to-mobile screen-size differences in creative ways, both from my own work and the wider realm of visual data journalism.

Talks.title: Big Ambition, Small Staff: How the F*** Do I Prioritize?
Talks.content: I co-facilitated a session to journalism technology professionals and students on how to efficiently, ambitiously do the work in newsrooms when your tech team is small (or only you).

VolunteerPositions.content: I helped to start up the independent supporters’ group for Boston Legacy FC, Boston’s new professional women’s soccer team. I designed the group’s inaugural brand and merchandise, and advised on the website build.
I joined up with the original independent supporters’ group for New England’s Major League Soccer team, designing a tifo display, print materials, and two supporters’ scarves for the 2025 season.

I met weekly with early-career data visualization professionals, advising them on both the technical side (D3/Svelte tutorials) and the business side (job-seeking advice) of the dataviz industry and offering critique for ongoing projects.
